news.title: Schindler sees modest 2026 revenue growth as China hurdles persist
news.para: Swiss company Schindler is forecasting a notable rise in revenue in 2026, primarily driven by strong local currency growth, particularly in Germany. This positive trend emerges against the backdrop of ongoing challenges in China's property market.

news.title: UK's Barratt Redrow cuts dividend as building costs squeeze margins
news.para: Britain's largest homebuilder Barratt Redrow has reported lower profits and cut its interim dividend. The company faces a challenging market with rising costs impacting margins. Despite these headwinds, Barratt Redrow expects to manage cost increases and maintain its profit forecast for the year.

news.title: Indiqube Spaces posts net loss of ₹17.06 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Indiqube Spaces recorded a net loss of ₹17.06 crore for the quarter ending December 31, 2025.  Total income reached ₹411.09 crore.  The company saw improved debt to equity ratio and ROCE.  Area under management and seat capacity grew significantly.

news.title: Relief for property buyers as revenue officers in Haryana end stir
news.para: Revenue officers in Haryana have ended their strike after assurances from the financial commissioner.  Tehsildars and naib tehsildars will resume duties Wednesday, following concerns over recent actions against them.  The government acknowledged their grievances and pledged fair examination, emphasizing their vital role and promising better communication and a supportive work environment.

news.title: Maharashtra: Gaothans rise against SRA survey drive
news.para: Body representing the indigenous East Indian community warns SRA survey could pave the way for Gaothans to be pushed into redevelopment

news.title: Maharaja of Tehri to sell 3.2 acre Delhi property for ₹1,000 crore
news.para: A significant property deal is underway in New Delhi. Maharaja Manujendra Shah of Tehri Garhwal is selling his 3.2-acre Bhagwan Das Road bungalow for around ₹1,000 crore. The buyer is a local entrepreneur from the food and beverage sector. This businessman is also set to acquire Jawaharlal Nehru's former residence for over ₹1,100 crore. Both are high-value assets.

news.title: Dubai builders reach for the Bollywood stars to deepen India connect
news.para: Dubai developers are increasingly using Bollywood stars to sell properties.  Actors like Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor, and Shah Rukh Khan are becoming brand ambassadors. This strategy aims to boost sales and reach Indian buyers.  Celebrity endorsements create trust and aspiration for buyers.  This approach helps developers stand out in a competitive market.

news.title: Carlyle Group to pick controlling stake in Nido Home Finance for ₹2,100 crore
news.para: Carlyle Group is acquiring a majority stake in Nido Home Finance, a subsidiary of Edelweiss Financial Services. Investment funds affiliated with Carlyle Asia Partners will invest Rs 2,100 crore. This partnership aims to boost affordable housing finance in rural and semi-urban India. Aditya Puri, former HDFC Bank CEO, will also invest.

news.title: Grasim Industries' profit up 28.7% to ₹2,233 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Grasim Industries' net profit rose by over 28 percent to Rs 2,232.95 crore for the December quarter.  Revenue from operations also saw a healthy increase of over 25 percent during the said quarter.

news.title: Maharashtra cabinet clears land policy for development of 'Third Mumbai'
news.para: Maharashtra cabinet approved a new policy for 'Third Mumbai' near Atal Setu. This plan aims to speed up urban development and investment in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region. The policy covers land acquisition and allotment for various projects. It will guide planned urbanisation and industrial growth in the Atal Setu influence area.

news.title: Ashiana Housing posts net profit of ₹56.65 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Ashiana Housing's net profit surged to ₹56.65 crore for the quarter ending December 31, 2025 from ₹10.85 crore in the same period last year. Total income also saw a substantial jump to ₹373.35 crore during the said quarter.

news.title: Arvind SmartSpaces' net profit falls 41.79% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Arvind SmartSpaces saw its net profit drop by over 41% in the quarter ending December 31, 2025. Total income also decreased compared to the previous year. The company announced leadership changes with Priyansh Kapoor becoming managing director and CEO.

news.title: The Leela Palaces takes over Centaur Hotels in Srinagar
news.para: The Centaur Srinagar, one of the last two Centaur Hotels, has been taken over by The Leela Palaces, Hotels and Resorts for a 60-year lease. Leela is investing Rs 300 crore in a major renovation, aiming to reopen the property with 170 larger rooms and branded houseboats by the end of next year.

news.title: Sonu Sood lease out commercial space to HDFC Bank for monthly rent of ₹11.75 lakh
news.para: Sonu Sood has signed a nine-year lease agreement with HDFC Bank for a commercial property in Trade Centre BKC, Mumbai. This deal begins with a monthly rental rate of ₹11.75 lakh, set to escalate by 15% every three years. The 2,700 sq ft unit, which Sood acquired in 2012, also offers parking facilities.

news.title: Turner International leases 46,000 sq ft workspace from WeWork India in Navi Mumbai
news.para: Turner International India has secured a large managed office space from WeWork India in Navi Mumbai. This new facility will accommodate over 650 employees.  WeWork India has expanded its capacity by 20,000 desks in the last year.

news.title: Wanted accused in Shine City fraud case held in Lucknow
news.para: The Economic Offences Wing (EOW) has arrested Nekpal Singh alias Nikki, a wanted accused in the multi-crore Shine City Infra Project Private Limited fraud case. Singh allegedly misled investors at the company's Lucknow office, promising to double their funds, before absconding. The EOW took him into custody from the Krishna Nagar police station area.

news.title: Nagpur: 55km phase-III to be metro’s longest expansion
news.para: Nagpur Metro's ambitious Phase 3 will add 54.5 km, including a significant 25 km stretch along the Inner Ring Road. This expansion, confirmed by Union Minister Nitin Gadkari, aims to boost connectivity across the city and industrial areas. The project will also explore driverless Metro operations, potentially making it India's first fully automated corridor.

news.title: Three townships coming up in Himachal Pradesh, says minister
news.para: Himachal Pradesh is set to launch ambitious urban development projects, including new townships in Baddi, Morni Hills, and near Kangra airport, to address housing demand and enhance public convenience. The state will also develop 919 residential units near Shimla, with a special quota for award winners. Policy reforms and commercial projects were also approved.

news.title: NHB pushes for lower home loan rates, lenders delay cuts till April
news.para: The National Housing Bank is pushing housing finance companies to lower lending rates for customers.  However, these companies plan to wait until April for their internal benchmarks to be reset before making significant rate cuts.  Some lenders have already made minor reductions.  This move aims to pass on reduced borrowing costs to existing borrowers.

news.title: Areion Group wins ₹936-crore bid for Aviom India Housing Finance
news.para: Areion Group secured the winning bid for Aviom India Housing Finance. Secured lenders unanimously backed Areion's Rs 936-crore offer. This plan offers lenders a recovery of about 65%. Unity Small Finance Bank had placed a higher bid but with conditions. Lenders preferred Areion's unconditional offer for certainty of recovery.
